message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.RO 

The paper deals with the problem of generating multi-view images from a single-view input, which is a fundamental problem in computer vision and graphics. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a new framework for generative adversarial networks (GANs) that addresses the problem of incomplete representations in the learned embedding space. This involves introducing a generation sideway to the single reconstruction path, which improves the generalization ability of the model. This suggests that the paper could also be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.GR (Graphics), which are closely related to computer vision. Finally, the paper also mentions the potential applications of multi-view generation in robotics, which suggests that it could be relevant to the sub-category of cs.RO (Robotics).
